title: Kindergarten Mathematics
teaser: Representing, relating, and operating on whole numbers; describing shapes and space.

children.title: Numbers To 10
children.teaser: The meaning of numbers to 10; patterns of “1 more” and “1 less”; addition within 5.

children.title: Attributes Of Two Related Objects
children.teaser: Matching pairs of objects and classifying by attributes.

children.title: Analyze To Find Two Objects That Are Exactly The Sam
children.teaser: Analyze to find two objects that are exactly the same or not exactly the same.

children.title: Analyze To Find Two Similar Objects
children.teaser: Analyze to find two similar objects--these are the same but…

children.title: Classify Two Objects By Attributes
children.teaser: Classify to find two objects that share a visual pattern, color, and use.

children.title: Classify To Make Categories And Count
children.teaser: Practice one-to-one counting; classify groups of objects into categories.

children.title: Classify Items Into Two Pre-Determined Categories
children.teaser: Classify items into two pre-determined categories.

children.title: Classify Items Into Three Categories And Determine The Count
children.teaser: Classify items into three categories, determine the count in each; reason about how the last number named determines the total.

children.title: Sort And Identify Categories By Count
children.teaser: Sort categories by count. Identify categories with two, three, and four within a given scenario.

children.title: Numbers To 5 In Different Configurations, Math Drawings, And Expressions
children.teaser: Determine how many objects and dots are in different linear, array, circular, and scattered configurations.

children.title: Sort By Count In Linear Configurations To 5; Match To Numerals
children.teaser: Sort by count in vertical columns and horizontal rows (linear configurations to 5). Match to numerals on cards.

children.title: Answer How Many Questions To 5. Compare Ways To Count 5 Fingers
children.teaser: Answer how many questions to 5 in linear configurations (5-group) with 4 in an array configuration. Compare ways to count 5 fingers.

children.title: Decompose 3, 4, 5 Within Linear And Array Dot Configurations
children.teaser: Within linear and array dot configuration of numbers 3, 4, and 5, decompose or find hidden partners.

children.title: Hidden Patterns Of 3,4, And 5 In Circular And Scattered Configurations
children.teaser: Within circular and scattered dot configurations of numbers 3, 4, and 5 find hidden partners.

children.title: Model Decompositions Of 3 With Materials, Drawings, And Expressions
children.teaser: Model decompositions of 3 with materials, drawings, and expressions. Represent the decomposition as 1 + 2 and 2 + 1.

children.title: The Concept Of Zero And Working With Numbers 0-5
children.teaser: Learn about zero; write and order numerals up to 5; represent decompositions.

children.title: Understand The Meaning Of Zero. Write The Numeral 0
children.teaser: Learn that the math word for "none" is "zero"; practice writing the numeral 0.

children.title: Represent Decompositions Of 1-3
children.teaser: Represent decompositions with materials, drawings, and equations.

children.title: Order And Write Numerals 0–3 To Answer How Many Questions
children.teaser: Count and write numerals 0-3; order numbers in a counting sequence.

children.title: Order And Write Numerals 4-5 To Answer How Many Questions
children.teaser: Order and write numerals 4 and 5 to answer how many questions; sort by count.

children.title: Decompose Totals Of 4 And 5 Without Equations
children.teaser: Write numerals 1–5 in order. Decompose totals of 4 and 5 without equations.

children.title: Working With Numbers 6-8 In Different Configurations
children.teaser: Count, order, and reason about numbers up to 8 using more difficult configurations.

children.title: Count 4–6 Objects In Linear And Array Configurations
children.teaser: Count 4–6 objects in linear and array configurations. Match 6 objects to the numeral 6.

children.title: Count 4–6 Objects In Circular And Scattered Configurations
children.teaser: Count 4–6 objects in circular and scattered configurations. Write numerals 1–6 in order.

children.title: Count 5─7 Linking Cubes In Linear Configurations
children.teaser: Count 5─7 linking cubes in linear configurations. Match with numeral 7. Count to 7.

children.title: Reason About Sets Of 7 Objects In Circular And Scattered Configurations
children.teaser: Reason about sets of 7 objects in circular and scattered configurations. Write numeral 7.

children.title: Compare Counts Of 8 In Linear And Array Configurations
children.teaser: Compare counts of 8 in linear and array configurations. Match with numeral 8.

children.title: Strategize To Count 8 Beans In Circular And Scattered Configurations
children.teaser: Strategize to count 8 beans in circular and scattered configurations. Write numeral 8.

children.title: Working With Numbers 9-10 In Different Configurations
children.teaser: Write, represent, count, and compare 9 and 10 objects in different configurations, stressing the importance of the unit of five.

children.title: Organize And Count 9 Objects In Linear And Array Configurations
children.teaser: Organize and count 9 varied geometric objects in linear and array configuration; emphasize unit of 5.

children.title: Strategize To Count 9 Objects In Circular And Scattered Configurations
children.teaser: Strategize to count 9 objects in circular and scattered configurations; number each object and write numerals up to 9.

children.title: Count 10 Objects In Linear And Array Configurations
children.teaser: Count 10 objects in linear and array configurations (5 and 5); match and write numeral 10.

children.title: Count 10 Objects In Linear And Array Configurations. (Continued)
children.teaser: Count 10 objects in linear and array configurations (2 fives); match and write numeral 10. (Continued)

children.title: Count 10 Objects And Move Between All Configurations
children.teaser: Count 10 objects; rearrange objects into different configurations and count in different paths.

children.title: Act Out Result Unknown Story Problems Without Equations
children.teaser: Act out story problems where the result is unknown, without using an equation.

children.title: One More With Numbers 0-10
children.teaser: Use two-dimensional objects to order and match numerals; understand that each successive number is one more.

children.title: State 1 More Than A Given Number
children.teaser: Order and match cards from 1 to 10. State 1 more than a given number.

children.title: Make Math Stairs From 1 To 10 In Cooperative Groups
children.teaser: Make math stairs of 1-10 linking cubes in cooperative groups.

children.title: Arrange, Analyze, And Draw 1 More Configurations Other Than Towers
children.teaser: Arrange, analyze, and draw 1 more up to 10 in configurations other than towers.

children.title: Explore Sequences Of Quantities Of 1 More
children.teaser: Explore sequences of quantities of 1 more, beginning with numbers other than 1.

children.title: One Less With Numbers 0-10
children.teaser: Understand that each successive number name refers to a quantity that is one greater and that the number before is one less.

children.title: Order Quantities From 10 To 1 And Match Numerals
children.teaser: Order quantities from 10 to 1 and match numerals in descending order.

children.title: Count Down From 10 To 1 And State 1 Less Than
children.teaser: Count down from 10 to 1 and state 1 less than a given number.

children.title: Arrange Number Towers In Order From 10 To 1 And Describe The Pattern
children.teaser: Make math stairs of 10-1 linking cubes in cooperative groups and describe the pattern.

children.title: Sequences Of Quantities That Are 1 Less In Configurations Other Than Towers
children.teaser: Arrange, analyze, and draw sequences of quantities that are 1 less in configurations other than towers.

children.title: Culminating Task
children.teaser: Complete series of tasks to count, represent, and order numbers 0-10.

children.title: Two-Dimensional And Three-Dimensional Shapes
children.teaser: Identify and describe two-dimensional and three-dimensional shapes.

children.title: Two-Dimensional Flat Shapes
children.teaser: Examine how flat shapes and objects are similar to or different from one another by various attributes.

children.title: Find And Describe Flat Triangles, Squares, Rectangles, Hexagons, And Circles
children.teaser: Find and describe flat triangles, squares, rectangles, hexagons, and circles using informal language without naming.

children.title: Classifying Rectangles Into Categories Using Examples And Non-Examples
children.teaser: Explain decisions about classifications of rectangles into categories. Identify shapes as rectangles.

children.title: Classifying Triangles Into Categories Using Examples And Non-Examples
children.teaser: Explain decisions about classifications of triangles into categories. Identify shapes as triangles.

children.title: Classifying Hexagons And Circles Into Categories Using Examples And Non-Examples
children.teaser: Explain decisions about classifications of hexagons and circles and identify them by name.

children.title: Describe And Communicate Positions Of All Flat Shapes
children.teaser: Describe and communicate positions of all flat shapes using the words above, below, beside, in front of, next to, and behind.

children.title: Three-Dimensional Solid Shapes
children.teaser: Examine how solid shapes and objects are similar to or different from one another by various attributes.

children.title: Find And Describe Solid Shapes Using Informal Language
children.teaser: Find and describe solid shape objects using informal language, without naming.

children.title: Classify And Name Solid Shapes
children.teaser: Explain decisions about classification of solid shapes into categories. Name the solid shapes.

children.title: Describe And Communicate Positions Of All Solid Shapes
children.teaser: Identify, name, and position shapes relative to each other.

children.title: Two-Dimensional And Three-Dimensional Shapes
children.teaser: Identify and sort flat and solid shapes based on their attributes.

children.title: Recognize Two-Dimensional And Three-Dimensional Shapes In Different Orientations And Sizes
children.teaser: Identify and sort shapes as two-dimensional or three-dimensional and recognize two-dimensional and three-dimensional shapes in different orientations and sizes.

children.title: Culminating Task
children.teaser: Groups display flat shapes with examples, non-examples, and a corresponding solid shape.

children.title: Comparison Of Length, Weight, Capacity, And Numbers To 10
children.teaser: Experiment with comparison of length, weight and capacity to build the meaning of the word “than”.

children.title: Comparison Of Length And Height
children.teaser: Comparison of length and height when endpoints are aligned and not aligned.

children.title: Compare Lengths With Aligned And Non-Aligned Endpoints
children.teaser: Compare lengths using taller than and shorter than with aligned and non-aligned endpoints.

children.title: Compare Length Measurements With String
children.teaser: Compare length measurements of classroom objects with string.

children.title: Make Series Of Longer Than And Shorter Than Comparisons
children.teaser: Compare two objects at a time and make longer than and shorter than comparisons; create longer than or shorter than objects.

children.title: Comparison Of Length And Height Of Linking Cube Sticks
children.teaser: Informal comparison of lengths and heights of linking cube sticks within 10 with a color change at 5.

children.title: Compare Linking Cube Sticks To A 5-Stick
children.teaser: Compare the length of linking cube sticks to a 5-stick.

children.title: Comparing Linking Cube Sticks
children.teaser: Determine which linking cube stick is taller than or shorter than the other.

children.title: Comparing Linking Cube Sticks To Various Objects
children.teaser: Compare the length of linking cube sticks to various objects.

children.title: Compare Objects Using The Same As
children.teaser: Break apart and compare objects using the same as.

children.title: Comparison Of Weight
children.teaser: Compare the weight of objects informally and by balance scale.

children.title: Compare The Weight Of Classroom Objects
children.teaser: Compare using heavier than and lighter than with classroom objects.

children.title: Compare Objects That Are Approximately The Same Using Balance Scales
children.teaser: Compare objects using heavier than, lighter than, and the same as with balance scales.

children.title: Compare The Weight Of An Object To A Set Of Weights On A Balance Scale
children.teaser: Compare the weight of one set of pennies to a solid object and determine how many pennies weigh the same as the object.

children.title: Observe Conservation Of Weight On The Balance Scale
children.teaser: Break apart the object on one side of the scale and observe that the two sides are still equal.

children.title: Compare The Weight Of An Object With Sets Of Different Objects
children.teaser: Balance the weight of an object with sets of different objects on a balance scale.

children.title: Comparison Of Volume
children.teaser: Compare volumes of different containers; notice conservation of volume.

children.title: Compare Volume Using More Than, Less Than, And The Same As By Pouring
children.teaser: Compare volume by pouring the same amount into containers of different volumes.

children.title: Explore Conservation Of Volume By Pouring
children.teaser: Understand conservation of volume by pouring the same amount into containers of size and shape.

children.title: Compare Using The Same As With Units
children.teaser: Count the number of scoops of rice within a container to compare volume.

children.title: Are There Enough?
children.teaser: Compare numbers of objects or size of objects; use more than, less than, and the same as.

children.title: Make Informal Comparison Of Area
children.teaser: Understand that shapes and objects can fit inside a square and that a square can be made of other squares.

children.title: Compare To Find If There Is Enough
children.teaser: See if there are enough, just enough, or not enough.

children.title: Compare Using More Than And The Same As
children.teaser: Compare using more than and the same as; create scenarios illustrating more than and the same as.

children.title: Compare Using Fewer Than And The Same As
children.teaser: Compare using fewer than and the same as; create scenarios illustrating fewer than and the same as.

children.title: Comparison Of Sets Within 10
children.teaser: Comparing numbers and sets of objects that have the same number of objects, have more objects, or have fewer objects.

children.title: Relate More And Less To Length
children.teaser: Count units and relate more and less to length.

children.title: Compare Sets Informally Using More, Less, And Fewer
children.teaser: Compare two sets of objects informally using more, less, and fewer.

children.title: Identify And Create A Set That Has The Same Number Of Objects
children.teaser: Count the number of objects in a set; create another set that has the same number of objects.

children.title: Reason To Identify And Make A Set That Has 1 More
children.teaser: Count the number of objects in a set; create another set that has 1 more object.

children.title: Reason To Identify And Make A Set That Has 1 Less
children.teaser: Count the number of objects in a set; create another set that has 1 less. object.

children.title: Comparison Of Numerals
children.teaser: Compare sets of objects in different visual configurations; using visualization (no materials) to make comparisons.

children.title: Match And Count To Compare A Number Of Objects
children.teaser: Match and count to compare a number of objects. State which quantity is more.

children.title: Match And Count To Compare Two Sets Of Objects
children.teaser: Match and count to compare two sets of objects. State which quantity is less.

children.title: Strategize To Compare Two Sets
children.teaser: Find strategies to compare two sets; begin to visualize sets with more than or less than a given set.

children.title: Visualize Quantities To Compare Two Numerals
children.teaser: Continue to visualize sets with different quantities and compare them using more than or less than.

children.title: Clarification Of Measurable Attributes
children.teaser: Engage in three measurement and comparison exploration tasks.

children.title: Observe Constant Volume Moving Between Different Containers
children.teaser: Observe cups of colored water of equal volume poured into a variety of container shapes.

children.title: Use Constant Weight To Make Different Sculptures
children.teaser: Use balls of clay of equal weights to make sculptures.

children.title: Create And Compare Rectangles Of Different Lengths To Build Structures
children.teaser: Use benchmarks to create and compare rectangles of different lengths to make a city.

children.title: Culminating Task
children.teaser: Culminating task—describe measurable attributes of single objects.

children.title: Number Pairs, Addition And Subtraction To 10
children.teaser: Reason about and solve addition and subtraction expressions and equations to 10.

children.title: Compositions And Decompositions Of 2, 3, 4, And 5
children.teaser: Compose and decompose using number bonds to explore the relationships between numbers.

children.title: Composition And Decomposition To 5 Using Objects And Drawings
children.teaser: Model composition and decomposition of numbers to 5 using actions, objects, and drawings.

children.title: Composition And Decomposition To 5 Using Fingers And Cube Sticks
children.teaser: Model composition and decomposition of numbers to 5 using fingers and linking cube sticks.

children.title: Represent Composition Stories Using Number Bonds
children.teaser: Represent composition story situations with drawings using numeric number bonds.

children.title: Represent Decomposition Stories Using Number Bonds
children.teaser: Represent decomposition story situations with drawings using numeric number bonds.

children.title: Composition And Decomposition To 5 Using Drawings And Number Bonds
children.teaser: Represent composition and decomposition of numbers to 5 using pictorial and numeric number bonds.

children.title: Represent Number Bonds With Composition And Decomposition
children.teaser: Represent number bonds with composition and decomposition story situations.

children.title: Decompositions Of 6, 7, And 8 Into Number Pairs
children.teaser: Decompose 6, 7, and 8 into all number pairs; model flexible thinking moving from part to whole and whole to part.

children.title: Model Decompositions Of 6
children.teaser: Model decompositions of 6 using a story situation, objects, and number bonds.

children.title: Model Decompositions Of 7
children.teaser: Model decompositions of 7 using a story situation, sets, and number bonds.

children.title: Model Decompositions Of 8
children.teaser: Model decompositions of 8 using a story situation, arrays, and number bonds.

children.title: Model Decompositions Of 6–8
children.teaser: Model decompositions of 6–8 using linking cube sticks to see patterns.

children.title: Represent Decompositions For 6–8 Using Number Bonds
children.teaser: Represent decompositions for 6–8 using horizontal and vertical number bonds.

children.title: Represent The 5 + N Pattern To 8
children.teaser: Use the 5‐groups to represent the 5 + n pattern to 8.

children.title: Addition With Totals Of 6, 7, And 8
children.teaser: Introduce formal addition concepts, including reading and writing expressions and equations.

children.title: Represent Decomposition And Composition Addition Stories To 6 With No Unknown
children.teaser: Represent decomposition and composition addition stories to 6 with drawings and equations with no unknown.

children.title: Represent Decomposition And Composition Addition Stories To 7 With No Unknown
children.teaser: Represent decomposition and composition addition stories to 7 with drawings and equations with no unknown.

children.title: Represent Decomposition And Composition Addition Stories To 8 With No Unknown
children.teaser: Represent decomposition and composition addition stories to 8 with drawings and equations with no unknown.

children.title: Solve Add To With Results Unknown Word Problems Within 8
children.teaser: Solve add to with result unknown word problems to 8 with equations. Box the unknown.

children.title: Solve Put Together With Total Unknown Word Problems Within 8
children.teaser: Solve put together with total unknown word problems to 8 using objects and drawings.

children.title: Solve Both Addends Unknown Word Problems Within 8
children.teaser: Solve both addends unknown word problems to 8 to find addition patterns in number pairs.

children.title: Subtraction From Numbers To 8
children.teaser: Introduce formal subtraction concepts, including reading and solving expressions and equations.

children.title: Use Objects And Drawings To Find How Many Are Left
children.teaser: Cross off objects and drawings to find out how many are left.

children.title: Solve Take From Expressions And Equations With No Unknown
children.teaser: Solve take from expressions and equations using the minus sign with no unknown.

children.title: Represent Subtraction Story Problems
children.teaser: Represent subtraction story problems using objects, drawings, expressions, and equations.

children.title: Decompose 6 Using 5-Group Drawings
children.teaser: Decompose the number 6 using 5-group drawings and record each decomposition.

children.title: Decompose 7 Using 5-Group Drawings
children.teaser: Decompose the number 7 using 5-group drawings and record each decomposition.

children.title: Decompose 8 Using 5-Group Drawings
children.teaser: Decompose the number 8 using 5-group drawings and record each decomposition.

children.title: Decompositions Of 9 And 10 Into Number Pairs
children.teaser: Model decomposition of 9 and 10 using number pairs in put together both addends unknown situations.

children.title: Model Decomposition Of 9 Using A Story Situation Or Objects
children.teaser: Model decompositions of 9 using a story situation, objects, and number bonds.

children.title: Model Compositions Of 9 Using Fingers And Linking Cubes
children.teaser: Model decompositions of 9 using fingers, linking cubes, and number bonds.

children.title: Model Decomposition Of 10 Using A Story Situation Or Objects
children.teaser: Model decompositions of 10 using a story situation, objects, and number bonds.

children.title: Model Compositions Of 10 Using Fingers And Linking Cubes
children.teaser: Model decompositions of 10 using fingers, sets, linking cubes, and number bonds.

children.title: Addition With Totals Of 9 And 10
children.teaser: Explore formal addition concepts with totals of 9 and 10, from no unknowns to totals or addends unknown.

children.title: Represent Pictorial Decomposition And Composition Addition Stories To 9
children.teaser: Represent pictorial decomposition and composition addition stories to 9 with 5-group drawings and equations with no unknown.

children.title: Represent Pictorial Decomposition And Composition Addition Stories To 10
children.teaser: Represent pictorial decomposition and composition addition stories to 10 with 5-group drawings and equations with no unknown.

children.title: Solve Add To With Total Unknown And Put Together With Total Unknown Problems
children.teaser: Solve add to with total unknown and put together with total unknown problems with totals of 9 and 10.

children.title: Solve Both Addends Unknown Word Problems Using 5-Group Drawings
children.teaser: Solve both addends unknown word problems with totals of 9 and 10 using 5-group drawings.

children.title: Subtraction From 9 And 10
children.teaser: Continue to practice formal subtraction concepts, including writing and solving number sentences with totals of 9 and 10.

children.title: Solve Take From Equations With No Unknown Using Numbers To 10
children.teaser: Represent and solve take from equations with no unknown using numbers to 10.

children.title: Represent Subtraction Story Problems To 10
children.teaser: Represent subtraction story problems by breaking off, crossing out, and hiding a part.

children.title: Decompose The Number 9 And Record With An Equation
children.teaser: Decompose the number 9 using 5-group drawings, and record each decomposition with an equation.

children.title: Decompose The Number 10 And Record With An Equation
children.teaser: Decompose the number 10 using 5-group drawings, and record each decomposition with an equation.

children.title: Patterns With Adding 0 And 1 And Making 10
children.teaser: Explore patterns when adding 0 and 1, the relationship between addition and subtraction, and making 10.

children.title: Additive Identity: Zero
children.teaser: Add or subtract 0; word problems wherein the same quantity that joins a set, separates.

children.title: Add 1 To Numbers 1–9 To See The Pattern
children.teaser: Add 1 to numbers 1–9 to see the pattern of the next number using 5-group drawings and equations.

children.title: Find The Number That Makes 10 And Record With A Drawing
children.teaser: Find the number that makes 10 for numbers 1–9, and record each with a 5-group drawing.

children.title: Find The Number That Makes 10 And Record With An Equation
children.teaser: Find the number that makes 10 for numbers 1–9, and record each with an addition equation.

children.title: Culminating Task
children.teaser: Choose tools strategically to model and represent a stick of 10 cubes broken into two parts.

children.title: Numbers 10─20; Count To 100 By Ones And Tens
children.teaser: Clarify the meaning of the 10 ones and some ones within a teen number.

children.title: Count 10 Ones And Some Ones
children.teaser: Count two separate parts within teen numbers, 10 ones and some ones; count the Say Ten way.

children.title: Count 10 As 10 Ones
children.teaser: Count straws into piles of ten; count the piles as 10 ones.

children.title: Describe A Count Of 10 To 20 Objects
children.teaser: Describe a count of 10 to 20 objects as 10 ones and __ ones.

children.title: Count And Circle 10 Objects Within Images Of 10 To 20
children.teaser: Count and circle 10 objects within images of 10 to 20 objects and describe.

children.title: Count Straws The Say Ten Way To 19
children.teaser: Count straws the Say Ten way to 19; make a pile for each ten.

children.title: Count Straws The Say Ten Way To 20
children.teaser: Count straws the Say Ten way to 20; make a pile for each ten.

children.title: Compose Numbers 11-20 From 10 Ones And Some Ones
children.teaser: Compose Numbers 11-20 from 10 Ones and Some Ones to understand the tens place in teen numbers.

children.title: Model With Objects And Represent Numbers 10 To 20
children.teaser: Model with objects and represent numbers 10 to 20 in an abstract way.

children.title: Model And Write Numbers 10 To 20 As Number Bonds
children.teaser: Model and write numbers 10 to 20 as number bonds composed of 10 and some ones.

children.title: Model Teen Numbers With Materials From Abstract To Concrete
children.teaser: Model numbers 10 to 20 by showing the number of objects.

children.title: Draw Teen Numbers From Abstract To Pictorial
children.teaser: Model numbers 10 to 20 by drawing the number of objects.

children.title: Decompose Numbers 11-20, And Count To Answer "How Many?"
children.teaser: Show, count, and write the numbers 11 to 20 using a variety of configurations to answer "how many".

children.title: Build A Rekenrek To 20
children.teaser: Build a Rekenrek to 20 to count and model numbers.

children.title: Show, Count, And Write Numbers 11 To 20 In Tower Configurations Increasing By 1
children.teaser: Show, count, and write numbers 11 to 20 in tower configurations increasing by 1—a pattern of 1 larger.

children.title: Represent Numbers 20 To 11 In Tower Configurations Decreasing By 1
children.teaser: Represent numbers 20 to 11 in tower configurations decreasing by 1—a pattern of 1 smaller.

children.title: Show, Count, And Write To Answer How Many Questions In Linear And Array Configurations
children.teaser: Show, count, and write to answer how many questions with up to 20 objects in linear and array configurations.

children.title: Show, Count, And Write To Answer How Many Questions In Circular Configurations
children.teaser: Show, count, and write to answer how many questions with up to 20 objects in circular configurations.

children.title: Extend The Say Ten And Regular Count Sequence To 100
children.teaser: Extend counting to 100; build understanding of how 1-9 repeats within decade.

children.title: Count Up And Down By Tens To 100 With Say Ten
children.teaser: Count up and down by tens to 100 with Say Ten and regular counting.

children.title: Count Within Tens By Ones
children.teaser: Count within tens by ones up to 100, trading ones for 10-frames.

children.title: Count Across Tens When Counting By Ones Through 40
children.teaser: Count across tens when counting by ones through 40, using the regular name and Say Ten way name.

children.title: Count Across Tens By Ones To 100
children.teaser: Count across tens by ones to 100 with and without objects.

children.title: Explore Numbers On The Rekenrek (Optional)
children.teaser: Explore decomposition of numbers to 100 on the Rekenek. (Optional)

children.title: Represent And Apply Compositions And Decompositions Of Teen Numbers
children.teaser: Reason, represent, apply, and compare teen number decompositions and compositions.

children.title: Represent Compositions And Decompositions As Addition
children.teaser: Represent teen number compositions and decompositions as addition sentences.

children.title: Represent Teen Number Decompositions And Find The Hidden Part
children.teaser: Represent teen number decompositions as 10 ones and some ones, and find a hidden part.

children.title: Decompose Teen Numbers And Compare Using The Some Ones
children.teaser: Decompose teen numbers as 10 ones and some ones; compare some ones to compare the teen numbers.

children.title: Represent Situations, Composing And Decomposing Teen Numbers
children.teaser: Reason about and represent situations, composing and decomposing teen numbers.

children.title: Culminating Task
children.teaser: Represent teen number decompositions in various ways.

children.title: Analyzing, Comparing, And Composing Shapes
children.teaser: Understand area through composition of geometric figures.

children.title: Building And Drawing Flat And Solid Shapes
children.teaser: Building and drawing flat and solid shapes and describing their construction.

children.title: Describe Construction Of Flat Shapes
children.teaser: Describe the systematic construction of flat shapes using ordinal numbers.

children.title: Build Flat Shapes With Varying Side Lengths
children.teaser: Build flat shapes with varying side lengths and record with drawings.

children.title: Compose Solids Using Flat Shapes As A Foundation
children.teaser: Review attributes of solids; compose solids using flat shapes.

children.title: Describe The Relative Position Of Shapes Using Ordinal Numbers
children.teaser: Describe the position of shapes using first, second, third, etc.

children.title: Composing And Decomposing Shapes
children.teaser: Combine simple shapes into compose larger ones.

children.title: Compose Flat Shapes Using Drawings
children.teaser: Compose flat shapes using pattern blocks and drawings.

children.title: Decompose Flat Shapes Into Two Or More Shapes
children.teaser: Decompose flat shapes into to or more shapes and record the exploration.

children.title: Compose Simple Shapes To Form A Larger Shape
children.teaser: Compose simple shapes to form a larger shape described by an outline.

children.title: Culminating Task
children.teaser: Culminating task—review selected topics to create a cumulative year-end project.
